edu.csupomona.cs.cs241.prog_assgmnt_1

Class NodeHeap<V extends java.lang.Comparable<V>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.csupomona.cs.cs241.prog_assgmnt_1.NodeHeap<V>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    edu.csupomona.cs.cs241.prog_assgmnt_1.Heap<V>

    public class NodeHeap<V extends java.lang.Comparable<V>>
extends java.lang.Object
implements edu.csupomona.cs.cs241.prog_assgmnt_1.Heap<V>
    This class creates a heap data structure using nodes created with the BinaryNode object. Created by Eric on 4/20/2015.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected int count
      count records the number of elements in the heap
      protected edu.csupomona.cs.cs241.prog_assgmnt_1.BinaryNode<V> root
      root holds the first node in the binaryheap

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      NodeHeap()
      The constructor always sets the root to null and count to 0

      boolean isEmpty()
      Checks if any elements are in the heap
      V remove()
      removes the root node of the heap, places the last element in the heap in its place, and then sifts down that node so that the heap will again satisfy the heap property.
      void siftDown(edu.csupomona.cs.cs241.prog_assgmnt_1.BinaryNode<V> nodeRef)
      Pushes a node down through the heap until it's children are both smaller than it
      void siftUp(edu.csupomona.cs.cs241.prog_assgmnt_1.BinaryNode<V> nodeRef)
      Bubbles up a node through the heap until it reaches a parent that is larger than it
      V[] toArray()
      This method uses a bredth first traversal method to go through the heap recording values from left to right, level by level.

    • Method Detail

      • getParentOfIndex

        public edu.csupomona.cs.cs241.prog_assgmnt_1.BinaryNode<V> getParentOfIndex(int pos)
        Finds the node that is the parent of the index entered. This method uses the structure of binary trees to find the node requested in logN time, assuming that you know the index of the node. "Index" in this case refers to what the index of the node would be if the node were in a binary heap. It is most useful when adding nodes to the heap
        Parameters:
        pos - refers to the index of the node being searched for
        Returns:
        a reference to the node at the index

      • getNodeAtIndex

        public edu.csupomona.cs.cs241.prog_assgmnt_1.BinaryNode<V> getNodeAtIndex(int pos)
        Finds the node at the position of the index entered. This method uses the structure of binary trees to find the node requested in logN time, assuming that you know the index of the node. "Index" in this case refers to what the index of the node would be if the node were in a binary heap. It is useful when removing nodes from the heap.
        Parameters:
        pos - refers to the index where the node will be
        Returns:
        a reference to the node at the specified index

      • siftUp

        public void siftUp(edu.csupomona.cs.cs241.prog_assgmnt_1.BinaryNode<V> nodeRef)
        Bubbles up a node through the heap until it reaches a parent that is larger than it
        Parameters:
        nodeRef - The node to be sifted up

      • siftDown

        public void siftDown(edu.csupomona.cs.cs241.prog_assgmnt_1.BinaryNode<V> nodeRef)
        Pushes a node down through the heap until it's children are both smaller than it
        Parameters:
        nodeRef - The node to be sifted down

      • add

        public void add(V in)
        Adds a new node into the heap. This method relies heavily on the getParentOfIndex() method to find out where the new node should go.
        Specified by:
        add in interface edu.csupomona.cs.cs241.prog_assgmnt_1.Heap<V extends java.lang.Comparable<V>>
        Parameters:
        in - the object to be added

      • remove

        public V remove()
        removes the root node of the heap, places the last element in the heap in its place, and then sifts down that node so that the heap will again satisfy the heap property.
        Specified by:
        remove in interface edu.csupomona.cs.cs241.prog_assgmnt_1.Heap<V extends java.lang.Comparable<V>>
        Returns:
        the object that was at the top of the heap (the largest object)

      • toArray

        public V[] toArray()
        This method uses a bredth first traversal method to go through the heap recording values from left to right, level by level. These values are stored in an array.
        Specified by:
        toArray in interface edu.csupomona.cs.cs241.prog_assgmnt_1.Heap<V extends java.lang.Comparable<V>>
        Returns:
        an array of the values in the heap in the order of a breadth first traversal.

      • fromArray

        public void fromArray(V[] array)
        Takes any array and inserts it into the heap. This could be performed on a heap that is empty or already has data inside of it.
        Specified by:
        fromArray in interface edu.csupomona.cs.cs241.prog_assgmnt_1.Heap<V extends java.lang.Comparable<V>>
        Parameters:
        array - the array to be entered into the heap

      • getSortedContents

        public V[] getSortedContents()
        Turns the heap into its array representation and then uses the heapsort method to sort it. This method originally had a parameter for an array, but I took it off because of the description on the assignment page which states: "The getSortedContents method should, internally, transform the heap into its array representation, and the perform Heap-Sort on it, then return the array as the result." Since it is internally transforming the heap into its array representation, there is no reason to pass the array representation in as a parameter.
        Specified by:
        getSortedContents in interface edu.csupomona.cs.cs241.prog_assgmnt_1.Heap<V extends java.lang.Comparable<V>>
        Returns:
        The sorted array representation of the heap.

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Checks if any elements are in the heap
        Returns:
        a boolean that is true if the heap is empty.
